controller.interfaces

Interface ICaretaker<X>

  • Type Parameters:
    X - Generic type used inside the class.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Caretaker

    public interface ICaretaker<X>
    Generic interface which describe a specific stack, in order to do in a better way the operations useful to implement memento pattern.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SIZE_MAX
      Maximum number of X objects which may be contained inside his structure.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(X x)
      * Add object X in the position after getCurrentPos() in the structure and update the current position.
      int getCurrentPos()
      It gives back the current position.
      X getPrev()
      It gives back the object in the previous position with respect to the object in position getCurrentPos().
      X getSucc()
      It gives back the object in the following position with respect to the object in position getCurrentPos().
      boolean prevExist()
      Method used to know if it exists an object in position getCurrentPos() - 1.
      boolean succExist()
      Method used to know if it exists an object in position getCurrentPos() + 1.

    • Field Detail

      • SIZE_MAX

        static final int SIZE_MAX
        Maximum number of X objects which may be contained inside his structure.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(X x)
        * Add object X in the position after getCurrentPos() in the structure and update the current position. If there are elements in higher positions with respect to getCurrentPos() they will be deleted before inserting a new object. If structure already contains SIZE_MAX objects inside it, then the oldest object added will be deleted before adding the new one.
        Parameters:
        x - object to be added in the structure.

      • getCurrentPos

        int getCurrentPos()
        It gives back the current position.
        Returns:
        It gives back the current position, if the structure is empty, it gives back -1.

      • getPrev

        X getPrev()
        It gives back the object in the previous position with respect to the object in position getCurrentPos().
        Returns:
        Previous object.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if prevExist() returns false.

      • getSucc

        X getSucc()
        It gives back the object in the following position with respect to the object in position getCurrentPos().
        Returns:
        Following object.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if succExist() returns false.

      • prevExist

        boolean prevExist()
        Method used to know if it exists an object in position getCurrentPos() - 1.
        Returns:
        true if it exists, otherwise it is false.

      • succExist

        boolean succExist()
        Method used to know if it exists an object in position getCurrentPos() + 1.
        Returns:
        true if it exists, otherwise it is false.
